abstracts.cdata!:
The project ratings are as follows:
            Project outcome is unsatisfactory; sustainability is
            unlikely; institutional development impact is modest; Bank
            performance is unsatisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            unsatisfactory. Lessons learned comprised the following
            recommendations: Perform in-depth institutional analysis;
            assess feasibility regarding the scope and size of projects;
            focus on few specific objectives with adequate sequencing
            and ensure they so not conflict; understand local context
            and reality; design an appropriate implementing agency; be
            flexible but proactive when encountering problems in
            implementation; realize the significance of the political
            context; involve nongovernmental organizations in delivering
            health services to improve the effectiveness of project
            interventions; realize that involving multiple donors can
            complicate project financing and implementation.

18157557.trustfund: TF024849-HUMAN RESOURCES UNIT IN LA PAZ,TF036913-BOLIVIA - INTEGRATED CHILD DEVELOPMENT,TF024852-SOCIAL SECTORS UNIT IN LA PAZ

abstracts.cdata!:
This project supports the Social
            Strategy Statement (SSS) of the Government of Bolivia (GOB)
            and its Ten-Year Action Plan for Children and Women. It
            contributes toward poverty alleviation and human capital
            development objectives by supporting the initiation of the
            Proyecto Integral de Desarrollo Infantil (PIDI), thus
            expanding coverage and improving quality of child
            development programs in poor urban and peri-urban areas of
            the 34 largest cities. The specific objectives of this
            project are to: (a) improve children's readiness to
            succeed in school and beyond by facilitating their physical,
            emotional, social and cognitive development; (b) enhance the
            status of women by increasing their employment
            opportunities, and expanding their knowledge of education,
            health and nutrition; and (c) increase community and private
            sector participation in the social development process. An
            associated objective of this project is to assist the GOB to
            strengthen its capacity to formulate and evaluate social
            policy. The project is comprised of three main components:
            (i) the sector policy development and management
            strengthening component enhances the public sector's
            capacity to formulate and evaluate social policy; (ii) the
            service delivery support component supports the delivery of
            integrated child development services to poor children; and
            (iii) close project performance monitoring and impact evaluation.
